instructions.title: How to use Base64 to WebP Converter

steps.title: Paste your Base64 string
steps.description: Copy and paste your Base64-encoded WebP data into the input area. The tool automatically detects data URL prefixes and removes them if present.

steps.title: Validate Base64 format
steps.description: The tool automatically validates your Base64 input and shows estimated file size. It checks for valid WebP (RIFF/WEBP) headers to ensure data integrity.

steps.title: Set custom filename (optional)
steps.description: Customize the output filename if needed. The tool auto-generates a timestamped filename by default for easy organization.

steps.title: Convert and analyze
steps.description: Click 'Convert to WebP' to process the data. The tool displays comprehensive WebP information including dimensions, compression type (Lossy/Lossless), alpha channel presence, animation status, and provides an instant preview with transparency support.

steps.title: Download your WebP
steps.description: Click 'Download WebP' to save the converted image to your device. The preview shows transparency correctly with a checkered background.

troubleshooting: Invalid Base64 error: Ensure input contains only valid Base64 characters (A-Z, a-z, 0-9, +, /, =)
No WebP header found: The data may be valid Base64 but not a WebP image - check the source
Preview not showing: Some older browsers may not support WebP - try Chrome, Firefox or Safari 14+
Memory issues: Try toggling preview off for very large or animated WebP files
Transparency not visible: The checkered background should make transparent areas obvious
Animation not playing: Browser may not support animated WebP or file may be static
